after all, people still sometimes post.

Hi,

has anyone found a way to import models from the game for use as fan artwork? I guess it is a tricky thing as there wouldn't be much difference in that, and effectively stealing some else's intellectual property. I enjoy 3D work, and would love to contribute to the fan work section. KSP deserves all of the affection it gets from fan art. What a fantastic game.

Thanks for any help

Hi,

has anyone found a way to import models from the game for use as fan artwork? I guess it is a tricky thing as there wouldn't be much difference in that, and effectively stealing some else's intellectual property. I enjoy 3D work, and would love to contribute to the fan work section. KSP deserves all of the affection it gets from fan art. What a fantastic game.

Thanks for any help

Well, I don't know how to get the current models.

But the pre 0.15 models can be imported as a .DAE model.

If you're having trouble importing it (like of you get an error when you try)

You have to open the .DAE file in a text editor, and get rid of the stuff between the [diffuse] tags.

Hi,

has anyone found a way to import models from the game for use as fan artwork? I guess it is a tricky thing as there wouldn't be much difference in that, and effectively stealing some else's intellectual property. I enjoy 3D work, and would love to contribute to the fan work section. KSP deserves all of the affection it gets from fan art. What a fantastic game.

Thanks for any help

As far as I know there isn't anything against it unless you sell you art. To get parts from the game you can use this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43513-Blender-mu-import-export-addon. As for other things you can use 3d model ripper. It's messy as hell but one you clean up it's good.

As far as I know there isn't anything against it unless you sell you art. To get parts from the game you can use this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43513-Blender-mu-import-export-addon. As for other things you can use 3d model ripper. It's messy as hell but one you clean up it's good.

Wow, thanks! That importer written by taniwha is fantastic. Pity it doesn't support all of the models yet. I tried using 3d model ripper, but found it just much too messy. Time to see if I can make a render
